Perform a Bulk Update Action on a vNode

Use this task to perform a bulk update action on one or more vNodes, and their respective cells. Changes to all tabs are covered in this task, however you can make bulk updates only to the tabs that apply to your parameter configuration changes.

  1. Use any of the following ways to access the Device Summary window:
    • Log into the PW EMS, this window displays by default.
    • From the navigation bar, click Dashboard.
    • From the navigation bar, click Devices > Device Summary.
  2. In the Device Summary window, in the Actions column, check the check box next to any vNode (s) on which you want to perform a bulk action.
  3. Click BULK Actions. In the drop-down list that appears, select Update.
  4. In the Confirm Navigation dialog box, click CONFIRM. For example:
  5. In the Bulk Actions Update window, the GENERAL PROFILES tab displays by default. Select a default or user-defined general profile from the Profile Name drop-down list. The general profile contains more general parameters of a device service profile. For example, the default general profile choices are: GSM Default, LTE Default, LTE Cell1, LTE Cell2.
  6. Make any applicable changes to the general profile you selected by changing any applicable parameters shown for it, and click UPDATE. Refer to the Create Device Profiles chapter for more information about the configuration of general profiles.
  7. Click the SYSTEM PROFILES window, and complete the following fields that are applicable to your bulk update of the vNode(s).

    Name

    Description
    Profile Type drop-down list Select from the following system profile types:
    • DownlinkQoS - This profile applies a Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) to data traffic from the HNG to access network devices, such as the RRH.
    • DownlinkShaping - This profile applies a DSCP to data traffic towards access devices such as an RRH from the HNG.
    • GsmConfig - This Global System for Mobile communications (GSM) profile is for a Converged Wireless System (CWS) access node, which performs as a multi-carrier node that operates as a standalone base station or Remote-Radio Head (RRH) connected to this vBBU.
    • HeartBeat - This profile is for cell heartbeat monitoring.
    • Logging - This profile is for system logging.
    • PkiSecurity - This profile is for system security, which includes the PKI certificate parameters required for server authentication.
    • QosUplink - This profile applies a DSCP to data traffic to the HNG from an access network devices profile that you created.
    • StatsInterval - This profile is for cell statistics monitoring.
    • TrShapingUplink - This profile is for network traffic shaping, which categorizes access network traffic.
    Profile Name drop-down list Select an profile name for the system profile type that you selected. System profile names appear only if there is a user-defined system profile for the Profile Type.
  8. Once a system profile name is selected, parameters display below. Use the search field to find specific system profile parameters to edit or make changes to the displayed parameters. Refer to the Configure System Settings for Devices chapter for more information about specifying these parameters.
  9. Click UPDATE. A bulk update is made for any profile parameter changes that you made on this tab.
  10. Click the DYNAMIC PROFILES tab and select LTE or GSM from the Select Profile Type to make changes to specific UE service parameters for a cell. Refer to the Create Device Profiles chapter for more information about the configuration of dynamic profiles.
  11. Click UPDATE. A bulk update is made for any profile parameter changes that you made on this tab.
  12. Click the HNG CONFIGURATION tab and complete any of the following applicable fields:

    Name

    Description
    Select HNG Name drop-down list Default is the only valid selection at this time.
    Select Service Type drop-down list Select LTE or GSM as the service type for cell traffic coming from this HNG device.
    Select LTE Service Name drop-down list

    This field appears if you selected LTE as the service type for this HNG.

    A Virtual eNodeB (VeNB) instance supports LTE services to the cell from the PW EMS. Each VeNB instance profile has a configuration that can include the Public Land Mobile Network (PLMN) identifier (ID), E-UTRAN Node B (eNB) ID, Mobility Management Entity (MME) IP addresses, the tracking area code (TAC), emergency area (EA) ID, and so on.

    Select from the following VeNBs:
    • venb1
    • venb2
    • venb3
    • venb4
    Select TAC drop-down list

    This field appears if you selected LTE as the service type for this HNG.

    Click to select one of the following Tracking Area Codes (TACs) for indicating the Traffic area in which the VeNB belongs. This TAC is unique within a Public Land Mobile Network (PLMN) wireless communications system:
    • 12593
    • 12594
    • 12595
    Select GSM Service Name drop-down list This field appears if you selected GSM as the service type for this HNG. Select the available GSM service profile.
    Select GPRS Service Name drop-down list Select the General Packet Radio Service (GPRS) QoS profile that contains DSCP values for packet-oriented mobile back-haul data network traffic. If there is no profile for this, select none.
    Select LAC field

    This field appears if you selected GSM as the service type for this HNG. Enter the four-digit hexadecimal value (0 to 9, a to f, A to F) GSM Location Area Code (LAC) ID. The default is 3134.

    NOTE: Changing this parameter requires a reboot of this vNode.
    Select RAC field

    This field appears if you selected GSM as the service type for this HNG. Enter the two-digit hexadecimal value (0 to 9, a to f, A to F) Routing Area Code (RAC) ID.
  13. Click UPDATE. A bulk update is made for any profile parameter changes that you made on this tab.
Parent topic: View Device Summary Information
